intro: Macairea bracteolaris, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It often grows in disturbed areas and can become invasive in certain regions. Macairea bracteolaris is used in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
